recipesJson.name: Custard NOW
recipesJson.author: EdibleMalfunction
recipesJson.description: For those that love Vanilla Custard, but don’t want to wait for their juice to steep, I give you this recipe. It’s my Custard, and I want it now.

reviews.text: Really nice Custard! After a long steep, also some cake ist there, from the Cheesecake.

Much like everyone else, I'm amazed at how good this custard is off the shake.  Sure, it gets better after about 48 hours, but to have a custard be this good this quickly is easily worth the five star rating.  Great job Ed.

The little bubbles are still there and it tastes fantastic, I approve 100%. If you're impatient like I am, it's only gonna get better from here, and I know that for a fact! 10/10 would mix again, and I will definitely mix again.
Well butter my butt and call me a biscuit, he ain't lying. Straight off the shake it's fantastic. Thank you.
INW Custard really is amazing. The fact that this recipe allows you to have an amazing custard as a SNV that only gets better with a few days steep is pretty amazing.

I know it's called "Custard Now" but if you let it steep for 3 weeks it get's even better! A very simple but complex tasting custard. Thanks for sharing it and getting me hip to INW Custard. I mixed this a long time ago, but forgot to rate it. Excellent recipe!
An absolutely fantastic custard. Ditch the Cap VC, fuck a steep, mix this shit up and enjoy a damn good custard.
Brilliant, truly a masterpiece and a great discovery.

CAP NY Cheesecake fills out the "Competition Custard" and FA Madagascar hits the right vanilla note here. Best tasting recipe ever? Nah, but pretty awesome to have a shake-and-vapeable vanilla custard. The list of "recipes inspired by this one" should be a lot longer than the one listed at this point. My head is swimming with ideas for other S&V custards using this as a base and if you give this a try, yours probably will be, too. This recipe feels like more than just a yummy and neat trick, it feels IMPORTANT.
Yep. It's good. Literally perfect if you're low on juice and need some custard in ya mouf
Really enjoying this. It was great off the shake and beyond, but I found at 1 week it really shines.
Holy fuck this shit is good. Thank you.
What a winner!!! I just rediscovered a bottle after an 8 week steep and it is absolutely stunning! Nice job!
Excellent recipe, No steep required. This recipe will be in my lineup for quite a while. Great job!
